CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in New Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 18, 1970, pg. 6, reads: "'Queens of Peace' - The Ladies Auxiliary of the Knights of St. Peter Claver, National Catholic Organization, set up a unit in Pittsburgh recently entitled 'Queen of Peace ' Court. Officers of the newly organized body, seated left to right are, Mmes. Peggy Bullard, corresponding secretary; Maggie Dow, vice grand lady; Charlene Wright, grand lady; Mary A. Walker, financial secretary; Evangeline Atkins, treasurer.  Standing, left to right, Rebecca Johnson, outer guard; Martha W. Gray, auditor; Centennial Samuels, inner guard; Sister Helen Mary, auditor and Louise Henderson, outer guard.  The initiation ceremony took place at Ozanam Center, with representatives of the national order in charge. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of Ladies Auxiliary of the Knights of St. Peter Claver, including seated from left: Peggy Bullard, Maggie Dow, Charlene Wright, Mary A. Walker, Evangeline Atkins; standing: Rebecca Johnson, Martha W. Gray, Centennial Samuels, Sister Helen Mary, and Louise Henderson, posed behind table in Ozanam Center
